def is_palindrome(text: str):
    """
    Checks if given string is a palindrome
    >>> is_palindrome('')
    True
    >>> is_palindrome('aba')
    True
    >>> is_palindrome('aaaaa')
    True
    >>> is_palindrome('zbcd')
    False
    """

    if text == '':
        return True

    n = len(text)
    mirror_text = ''
    for i in range(n):
        mirror_text += text[n - i - 1]

    return text == mirror_text

def is_palindrome(text: str):
    """
    Checks if given string is a palindrome
    >>> is_palindrome('')
    True
    >>> is_palindrome('aba')
    True
    >>> is_palindrome('aaaaa')
    True
    >>> is_palindrome('zbcd')
    False
    """
    text = text.upper()
    len_text = len(text)
    len_cpy = len_text
    rev = text[::-1]
    while len_cpy >= 2:
        if text[len_cpy - 1]!= rev[len_cpy - 1]:
            return False
        else:
            len_cpy -= 1
    return True if len_cpy == 0 else False

    """
    if len(text) == 0:
        return True
    if len(text) == 1:
        return text == text[::-1]
    return text[:len(text)//2] == text[len(text)//2:] == text[len(text)//2:] == text[:len(text)//2][::-1]

def is_palindrome(text: str):
    """
    Checks if given string is a palindrome
    >>> is_palindrome('')
    True
    >>> is_palindrome('aba')
    True
    >>> is_palindrome('aaaaa')
    True
    >>> is_palindrome('zbcd')
    False
    """
    if len(text) == 0:
        return True
    # strip all chars from the right of the string and check if they match
    left = text[:-1]
    right = text[1:]
    # take first character and compare
    if left[0]!= right[0]:
        return False
    # compare rest of the string
    return is_palindrome(left + right)
